intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. crispa, commonly known as curly kale, is a cool-season crop characterized by its thick, crinkled, dark green leaves. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a rosette of broad, wavy leaves that are tightly curled. It is cultivated for its edible leaves, which are rich in vitamins and minerals, and is a popular ingredient in various cuisines. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
